speaker: CLIFFORD
text_entry: SCENE IV. Another part of the field.

speaker: CLIFFORD
text_entry: Alarum. Enter YORK

speaker: YORK
text_entry: The army of the queen hath got the field:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: My uncles both are slain in rescuing me;

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And all my followers to the eager foe

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Turn back and fly, like ships before the wind

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Or lambs pursued by hunger-starved wolves.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: My sons, God knows what hath bechanced them:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: But this I know, they have demean'd themselves

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Like men born to renown by life or death.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Three times did Richard make a lane to me.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And thrice cried 'Courage, father! fight it out!'

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And full as oft came Edward to my side,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: With purple falchion, painted to the hilt

speaker: YORK
text_entry: In blood of those that had encounter'd him:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And when the hardiest warriors did retire,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Richard cried 'Charge! and give no foot of ground!'

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And cried 'A crown, or else a glorious tomb!

speaker: YORK
text_entry: A sceptre, or an earthly sepulchre!'

speaker: YORK
text_entry: With this, we charged again: but, out, alas!

speaker: YORK
text_entry: We bodged again; as I have seen a swan

speaker: YORK
text_entry: With bootless labour swim against the tide

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And spend her strength with over-matching waves.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: A short alarum within

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Ah, hark! the fatal followers do pursue;

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And I am faint and cannot fly their fury:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And were I strong, I would not shun their fury:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: The sands are number'd that make up my life;

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Here must I stay, and here my life must end.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Enter QUEEN MARGARET, CLIFFORD, NORTHUMBERLAND, PRINCE EDWARD, and Soldiers

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Come, bloody Clifford, rough Northumberland,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: I dare your quenchless fury to more rage:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: I am your butt, and I abide your shot.

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
text_entry: Yield to our mercy, proud Plantagenet.

speaker: CLIFFORD
text_entry: Ay, to such mercy as his ruthless arm,

speaker: CLIFFORD
text_entry: With downright payment, show'd unto my father.

speaker: CLIFFORD
text_entry: Now Phaethon hath tumbled from his car,

speaker: CLIFFORD
text_entry: And made an evening at the noontide prick.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: My ashes, as the phoenix, may bring forth

speaker: YORK
text_entry: A bird that will revenge upon you all:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And in that hope I throw mine eyes to heaven,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Scorning whate'er you can afflict me with.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Why come you not? what! multitudes, and fear?

speaker: CLIFFORD
text_entry: So cowards fight when they can fly no further;

speaker: CLIFFORD
text_entry: So doves do peck the falcon's piercing talons;

speaker: CLIFFORD
text_entry: So desperate thieves, all hopeless of their lives,

speaker: CLIFFORD
text_entry: Breathe out invectives 'gainst the officers.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: O Clifford, but bethink thee once again,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And in thy thought o'er-run my former time;

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And, if though canst for blushing, view this face,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And bite thy tongue, that slanders him with cowardice

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Whose frown hath made thee faint and fly ere this!

speaker: CLIFFORD
text_entry: I will not bandy with thee word for word,

speaker: CLIFFORD
text_entry: But buckle with thee blows, twice two for one.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Hold, valiant Clifford! for a thousand causes

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: I would prolong awhile the traitor's life.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Wrath makes him deaf: speak thou, Northumberland.

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
text_entry: Hold, Clifford! do not honour him so much

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
text_entry: To prick thy finger, though to wound his heart:

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
text_entry: What valour were it, when a cur doth grin,

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
text_entry: For one to thrust his hand between his teeth,

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
text_entry: When he might spurn him with his foot away?

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
text_entry: It is war's prize to take all vantages;

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
text_entry: And ten to one is no impeach of valour.

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
text_entry: They lay hands on YORK, who struggles

speaker: CLIFFORD
text_entry: Ay, ay, so strives the woodcock with the gin.

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
text_entry: So doth the cony struggle in the net.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: So triumph thieves upon their conquer'd booty;

speaker: YORK
text_entry: So true men yield, with robbers so o'ermatch'd.

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
text_entry: What would your grace have done unto him now?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Brave warriors, Clifford and Northumberland,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Come, make him stand upon this molehill here,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: That raught at mountains with outstretched arms,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Yet parted but the shadow with his hand.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: What! was it you that would be England's king?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Was't you that revell'd in our parliament,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And made a preachment of your high descent?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Where are your mess of sons to back you now?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: The wanton Edward, and the lusty George?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And where's that valiant crook-back prodigy,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Dicky your boy, that with his grumbling voice

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Was wont to cheer his dad in mutinies?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Or, with the rest, where is your darling Rutland?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Look, York: I stain'd this napkin with the blood

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: That valiant Clifford, with his rapier's point,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Made issue from the bosom of the boy;

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And if thine eyes can water for his death,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: I give thee this to dry thy cheeks withal.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Alas poor York! but that I hate thee deadly,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: I should lament thy miserable state.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: I prithee, grieve, to make me merry, York.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: What, hath thy fiery heart so parch'd thine entrails

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: That not a tear can fall for Rutland's death?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Why art thou patient, man? thou shouldst be mad;

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And I, to make thee mad, do mock thee thus.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Stamp, rave, and fret, that I may sing and dance.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Thou wouldst be fee'd, I see, to make me sport:

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: York cannot speak, unless he wear a crown.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: A crown for York! and, lords, bow low to him:

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Hold you his hands, whilst I do set it on.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Putting a paper crown on his head

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Ay, marry, sir, now looks he like a king!

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Ay, this is he that took King Henry's chair,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And this is he was his adopted heir.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: But how is it that great Plantagenet

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Is crown'd so soon, and broke his solemn oath?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: As I bethink me, you should not be king

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Till our King Henry had shook hands with death.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And will you pale your head in Henry's glory,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And rob his temples of the diadem,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Now in his life, against your holy oath?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: O, 'tis a fault too too unpardonable!

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Off with the crown, and with the crown his head;

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And, whilst we breathe, take time to do him dead.

speaker: CLIFFORD
text_entry: That is my office, for my father's sake.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Nay, stay; lets hear the orisons he makes.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: She-wolf of France, but worse than wolves of France,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Whose tongue more poisons than the adder's tooth!

speaker: YORK
text_entry: How ill-beseeming is it in thy sex

speaker: YORK
text_entry: To triumph, like an Amazonian trull,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Upon their woes whom fortune captivates!

speaker: YORK
text_entry: But that thy face is, vizard-like, unchanging,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Made impudent with use of evil deeds,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: I would assay, proud queen, to make thee blush.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: To tell thee whence thou camest, of whom derived,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Were shame enough to shame thee, wert thou not shameless.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Thy father bears the type of King of Naples,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Of both the Sicils and Jerusalem,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Yet not so wealthy as an English yeoman.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Hath that poor monarch taught thee to insult?

speaker: YORK
text_entry: It needs not, nor it boots thee not, proud queen,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Unless the adage must be verified,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: That beggars mounted run their horse to death.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: 'Tis beauty that doth oft make women proud;

speaker: YORK
text_entry: But, God he knows, thy share thereof is small:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: 'Tis virtue that doth make them most admired;

speaker: YORK
text_entry: The contrary doth make thee wonder'd at:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: 'Tis government that makes them seem divine;

speaker: YORK
text_entry: The want thereof makes thee abominable:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Thou art as opposite to every good

speaker: YORK
text_entry: As the Antipodes are unto us,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Or as the south to the septentrion.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: O tiger's heart wrapt in a woman's hide!

speaker: YORK
text_entry: How couldst thou drain the life-blood of the child,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: To bid the father wipe his eyes withal,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And yet be seen to bear a woman's face?

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Women are soft, mild, pitiful and flexible;

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Thou stern, obdurate, flinty, rough, remorseless.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Bids't thou me rage? why, now thou hast thy wish:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Wouldst have me weep? why, now thou hast thy will:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: For raging wind blows up incessant showers,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And when the rage allays, the rain begins.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: These tears are my sweet Rutland's obsequies:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And every drop cries vengeance for his death,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: 'Gainst thee, fell Clifford, and thee, false

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Frenchwoman.

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
text_entry: Beshrew me, but his passion moves me so

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
text_entry: That hardly can I cheque my eyes from tears.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: That face of his the hungry cannibals

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Would not have touch'd, would not have stain'd with blood:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: But you are more inhuman, more inexorable,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: O, ten times more, than tigers of Hyrcania.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: See, ruthless queen, a hapless father's tears:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: This cloth thou dip'dst in blood of my sweet boy,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And I with tears do wash the blood away.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Keep thou the napkin, and go boast of this:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And if thou tell'st the heavy story right,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Upon my soul, the hearers will shed tears;

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Yea even my foes will shed fast-falling tears,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And say 'Alas, it was a piteous deed!'

speaker: YORK
text_entry: There, take the crown, and, with the crown, my curse;

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And in thy need such comfort come to thee

speaker: YORK
text_entry: As now I reap at thy too cruel hand!

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Hard-hearted Clifford, take me from the world:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: My soul to heaven, my blood upon your heads!

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
text_entry: Had he been slaughter-man to all my kin,

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
text_entry: I should not for my life but weep with him.

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
text_entry: To see how inly sorrow gripes his soul.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: What, weeping-ripe, my Lord Northumberland?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Think but upon the wrong he did us all,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And that will quickly dry thy melting tears.

speaker: CLIFFORD
text_entry: Here's for my oath, here's for my father's death.

speaker: CLIFFORD
text_entry: Stabbing him

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And here's to right our gentle-hearted king.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Stabbing him

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Open Thy gate of mercy, gracious God!

speaker: YORK
text_entry: My soul flies through these wounds to seek out Thee.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Dies

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Off with his head, and set it on York gates;

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: So York may overlook the town of York.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Flourish. Exeunt
